On the surface of the sea, four words sailed aimlessly; their names: Wind, Fire, Rock and Water. Agua didn’t mind sailing aimlessly, in fact, he loved it! On the other hand, Fire, despite being contained in a bottle and lit on a small piece of paper, was agonizing with fear due to the proximity of Water; and even when his pain was atrocious, Wind tried to save him as best he could every time the poor thing seemed to be extinguished.
Rock, with the help of Water, broke the bottle, and fire was released. Wind, flew without problems, decided to take a walk to feel the nature of the island more closely, and promised to return. Water swam as he wanted on the seashore, and Fire, free and far from Water, headed with the help of Wind to a pile of dry logs to heat them and spend the night there. The next morning he returned. Water was attentive, and Rock, happy with his new friends. But, suddenly, the four heard a loud noise approaching, it was the man with his machines, intending to destroy everything as his nature dictates. Rock, the fourth word, due to its condition, could not move and looked at the other three. He got there, thanks to a board that served as support. Witnessing the events, she asked Water to hold her and Wind to push with all her strength until they reached the island. Water and Wind obeyed Rock without questioning and finally reached dry land.
Four words
It was at that moment that the four words realized that each of them would survive if they stayed together. And even when in certain situations Water and Fire enter into combat, and Wind, who sometimes does not decide which side to take, on the advice of Rock who had barely managed to move, followed them. The four words knew that despite having differences, the union made them strong. As for the man, he fled in terror at the unusual experience he had experienced. Water entered the sea and produced strong waves that dragged the infernal machines; Rock, on his board pushed by Wind, formed a barrier together with other companions to defend the forests; and Fire, thanks to the fact that Water wet the engine of the machines, took the opportunity to set them on fire, producing a short circuit.

Life’s little things © Joel Aguilozi, 2020
Tell the story… no, it started badly, like it did a few years ago when I started writing, it definitely started badly, badly, like Edward Venit the day his life changed forever.
One day, Edward went to sleep, upset at his lack of luck; So much so that he earned the nickname “yeta Venit”. That day Edward invoked whoever would listen to him from beyond, from another galaxy, or who knows where, to free him from his bad luck…And he was heard; Edward transformed himself, just as Gregorio Samsa did, into an insect; the good luck insect!; a cricket First he called his girlfriend who, upon seeing him, couldn’t believe what she saw. -Finished! – was what he said. This is how family and even friends passed, who little by little abandoned him; The only one who did not abandon him was Pedro, one of those friends to whom Edward did not pay much attention.
Pedro visited Edward every day since he acquired his insectoid form, and his luck changed completely; so much so that: The casino that Pedro went to, he broke the bank! Woman he wanted, he had her! Edward acquired so much fame, due to his good luck, that his relatives returned to him, and OH surprise! They became rich, his girlfriend also returned and OH surprise! She also became rich.
Edward, happy and excited, without caring about his appearance, showed himself in public. The result? They put him in a laboratory to investigate it, and Oh surprise!, the scientists’ luck also changed. And since everything has a limit, and freedom is priceless, Edward escaped one moonless night, as a song from my childhood said, and went wherever the wind took him. He arrived at an unknown place, and the inevitable happened; When everyone saw him, they reacted in horror, and they even tried to kill him with insecticide. And he ran, or rather jumped, like he had never done before. He returned to his apartment and when he turned on the television he saw channels from all over the country. Confused, to calm his nerves, he smoked a pipe and went to sleep. They had told him that smoking that substance gives you wings and takes you through magical and pleasant worlds and that when you wake up everything would look different. And it was true, when he woke up he was alone, he felt bad, anxious, sad, without remembering his supposedly pleasant dreams, without friends, without a girlfriend, disowned by his family, and prisoner of a dream of smoke. In a moment of lucidity, he realized that he had dreamed it all. The phone rang, it was Pedro… that friend I didn’t pay much attention to. – Put some clothes in a bag and let’s go together to seek freedom. I have the address; I lived in that place for some time and luckily I found it.
Although the years lost are irrecoverable, it is important to treasure what has been learned. Edward knew how to value the difference between good and bad; the consequences that errors leave when they are not corrected in time, and how the essence of any spell is lost, which is nothing more than a balloon full of smoke. Edward stopped being a cricket, and many years later, sitting in his pine wood rocking chair, while enjoying a summer night, scented with jasmine and musicalized by the monotonous song of crickets, he remembered what lived and kept it forever in his thoughts, along with the small but important things in life.

content:
Love is not a crime © Joel Aguilozi, 2020
I woke up to the gray light of dawn; I had spent a quiet, dreamless night, and I felt like a new man. However, my concerns remained the same as always, the hours of rest did not change anything. I looked out the window.
Iván, in his underwear, shook the carpet in the middle of the park.
He greeted me cordially like every day; I asked him why he shook the carpet so hard, “I washed it yesterday” I told him; I smiled and thought “his obsession hasn’t changed since I met him, he always wants to have everything in order, maybe that’s what sparked part of my love for him”, I still remember the day when I told my father that I had fallen in love… And How can I not remember him, if that was the last day I spent in my house, the last day he spoke to me. He didn’t want to go say goodbye to me. I would have wanted to say goodbye, or simply “I love you old man.”
Why not understand that this was my destiny? He could not forgive me, and it was unfortunate that Iván did not fill that void for now. Sometimes while trying to fall asleep I ask myself, why does discrimination exist? Perhaps no one has the answer, perhaps the nature of human beings is to fear what is different, and put it aside without knowing what it is about, letting themselves be carried away by the canons of an intolerant society.
I got up to have breakfast with Iván. We had already lived together for two years, and in the mornings we used to tell each other the dreams that had invaded our minds while we were sleeping. I, that night, I hadn’t had dreams or nightmares, his smile didn’t calm me like it did every morning, and knowing him, I sensed that he was hiding something.
In a few seconds everything changed in both of our lives – Not long ago I was diagnosed with HIV – he said.
The first thing I thought was the most logical thing in those circumstances… that meant that I also suffered from the disease. It was not the time to make reproaches or look for blame, the only thing I said to him was: – Why did it take you so long to tell me? “I didn’t know how you were going to take it,” was the response. The first week was terrifying, the nightmares came back; Possibly they were trying to tell me that they had already warned me recently. In the middle of the night he woke up next to Iván, drenched in sweat and shaking with fear of what was coming. I remembered that God exists and I fervently asked him not to be true.
The first month passed, and after the studies, I knew that at most we had a few more years to live, but that was when everything changed for me, and for Iván. We decided to accept things as they were, to move on with our lives. We made those last years our most valuable treasure.
Every moment, every day, was full of joy, and without realizing it we discovered how to find happiness despite our great problems. We learned that death is not the end of everything; that happiness is in front of us and sometimes we don’t find it. I had to go through that, to understand that life is made up of moments and it is up to us to illuminate them or leave them in the dark. Today after a long time, I was able to meet my old man again and say “I love you.”

content:
Mark’s Mission © Joel Aguilozi, 2020
Mark bought his first house with the money he saved from his job on cruise ships. He spoke fluently Spanish, German, French and even a little Russian and of course English, his native language.
He had been away from England for three months and the month of November was already entering. They had crossed the Atlantic to Barbados and I was looking forward to return to your new home.
Finally the day came, and when he entered he couldn’t believe it, the house was full of rats. They came and went from one place to another, he thought about calling the fumigator and the owner of the home.
–Hey idiot, what do you think you’re going to do? – one of the rats told him. We are here to help you, you are the chosen one – Now, Mark did not understand anything, and this time he was not joking. The rat climbed onto a wooden bench that Mark built before leaving and, stretching out his paw, said: -Nice to meet you, my name is Jo. Mark, stupefied, could not coordinate his thoughts. The rat was talking and even greeting him! Maybe it was a trick that the whiskey played on him, or it was an absurd dream. No, it wasn’t, Jo was real, and so were the rest of the people around him, Mark. He was not drunk or drugged, nor was he dreaming; So what was happening?
Without saying anything, Jo jumped out of the chair and hit him on the head. –Idiot is not a dream! –he said furiously. Seeing that Mark was not listening to reason, Jo explained to him: –Many years ago; a god terrible sent us the rats as punishment for the sins of humanity; producing many diseases, because of this we rats adopted a repulsive nature and were even hated, it was time for this to change
-What do you mean? –Mark, you are immune to all diseases. You can create vaccines for almost any virus, just with your cells. That will take you a lifetime. Tell me, do you really think it was a coincidence that you bought this house? God’s will exists and now he is putting you to the test. Follow me, maybe then you will understand better.
They went down to the basement and Mark found strange devices; It was the legacy of the former owner of the house. At first it was not easy for Mark to assimilate these events. “Son, you are up for great things,” his father often told him, and he was not wrong. Mark began working and discovered his talent for science, a talent that remained hidden.
The years passed and the plagues ceased without anyone knowing about Mark. However, something worried him; Not having fame! Jo, I always told him “calm down, everything will come”, what Mark didn’t know was that for the first time, he was honoring his own existence and that of many people.
One day, the fame Mark was looking for came.
Now if you allow me to tell you, dear reader, I think I am in a position to tell you that Jo and the entourage were nothing more nor less than angels, angels sent with a single mission; avoid so much suffering.

Silver for Rest © Joel Aguilozi, 2020
Helsinki, 1920. Jukka and Kalevi were looking for the town doctor, a man named Eikki. The work had to be quick and easy. The pay was good.
With the rifle with silver bullets behind them, they arrived at the doctor’s house when the sun was just rising. They knocked on the door without caring if the man was still sleeping. He opened it, and upon seeing them, he suspected who they were (in small towns there are things that are impossible to hide). After a brief presentation he learned that the legends were true, Jukka and Kalevi the ghost hunters, were real and not mythical tales. Furthermore, it was said that they were also ghosts.
“Let me offer you a glass of cider, the best in town,” Eikki said as he served them, and without detours, he began to speak; “The job consists of putting an end to a ghost that haunts the forest causing terror and death.” among the inhabitants of the town –. The mission of our hunters was to kill him and take his ashes to Eikki’s cabin. It seemed like a simple job, however, according to Kalevi, something was wrong. Why did the doctor want the ashes of a soul in pain? Intrigued, he asked the doctor who answered. –I am working on the formula to achieve immortality.
They decided not to get involved in other people’s affairs and complete the work; At the end of the day what mattered was the money to be collected. Ask they had to inspect the house before leaving. On an altar surrounded by candles, there was the photo of Eikki’s wife, who had died a month ago due to an epidemic that took several lives, and supposedly the ghost they had to find. They waited until dusk to enter the forest, the place where she had been seen the night before.
The wait was long. Almost at dawn it appeared and there was no room for confusion; It was Eikki’s wife. The apparition tried to steal the spirit of both men, not knowing that it was not in front of two humans; but in front of two benevolent ghosts, who tried to give rest to the souls that still wandered.
The legends were true, Jukka and Kalevi did not belong to this world. When Makki was finally able to rest in peace, she confessed that Eikki had murdered her and was responsible for creating a formula that caused the plague that hit the town. According to the doctor, to achieve immortality he needed to find the “spiritual essence of love”, an essence that he could only obtain in the ashes of his wife’s ghost.
Eikki was wrong, he just wanted to give his wife a rest to recover some of his lost sanity, and why not, forgiveness, but that’s another story.

The essential is invisible to the eyes © Joel Aguilozi, 2020
Outside, the sun was shining brightly, for everyone except Adrian.
His case was extremely rare; He was almost blind during the day, but not at night. And he wasn’t albino.
Until now, no other person in the world was known to suffer from this very rare disease, so since they noticed this anomaly when he was just a child, they nicknamed him “the dark child.” Observing the night and its eternal magic was frustrating for Adrián, he longed for daylight even though he did not know it. Medical specialists from all countries were interested in his daytime blindness and studied it, but they could not find the cause; The truth is that his family was desperate to find a cure for poor Adrián, who during the day (which seemed eternal) took refuge in his room, like a solitary prisoner, although as much as possible, he tried to concentrate. in the memory of his grandfather who always told him, “everything has a purpose in life and what for some is strange and even abnormal, for others is a gift that God gave us to fulfill a mission.”
Adrián’s case was gaining interest, and what for many was a curse gave him different opportunities, since the lack of one sense exacerbates the others. He completed his studies without difficulties at a night university, and due to his ability and intelligence, he received a scholarship. “There is no evil that does not come with good” say the people knew. Despite that, he continued with his dream of “seeing the light”; although there was he learned not to despair because of his condition and always found a motivation that drove him not to give up in the face of any difficulty.
Something that was difficult for him to understand was why other young people constantly complained about small things that were really unimportant.
The years passed and one day Adrián fell in love with a young woman who visited him often. He attended the parish every afternoon to give two hours of his time to anyone who needed company and he did more of two months that he stopped by Adrián’s house to chat for a while. Like him, Micaela pursued a dream, to see the light, Micaela was blind from birth. They shared afternoons and set goals, and although many did not understand that love in the dark, Micaela and Adrián were happy. That made one thing clear; Happiness can have several facets, but no excuses.

I was running in a forest. He didn’t distinguish colors. Everything looked black and white. Someone was chasing me. I just ran, ran, ran.
I felt terror, and I told myself; “this is my end.” I closed the eyes. Wait. Nothing was happening, so I decided to open them. That being extended his hand in a friendly manner and said: join me and do justice. But where was that voice coming from? It didn’t take me long to realize that it was a transmission from mind to mind. I didn’t know what he was referring to, or what justice he was talking about. Suddenly an inexplicable force made me fall and then a vision showed me the evil of the world. It was not new to me, and I accepted, I sinned, and I accepted. I let the flesh say goodbye to my spirit; that dirty and cursed flesh that made me commit so many blunders, that made me take solace when bad things happened to someone else. He walked with difficulty on human bones. My eyes lit up in flames that illuminated my surroundings. From among enormous columns of bones that stood against the walls, other similar and terrifying beings suddenly appeared.
–Follow me–they invited me. I obeyed, I had no choice.
He kept jumping around me laughing tirelessly. I didn’t know what to expect, until suddenly, he touched my head and showed me the truth. He had unleashed supreme destruction. The same Apocalypse. Thanks to my desire to take justice into my own hands, the people I refused to kill were now suffering in a hell worse than mine. I didn’t think twice and I didn’t stop to meditate on his message.

content:
The Pharox Paradox © Joel Aguilozi, 2020
Sometimes when we are not satisfied with our lives, with what wedo, we mistakenly wish for changes that did not occur, and weask ourselves, What if I had done this? What would my life belike? If I had finished university? Or would I have mademore money? Paradoxes exist, many of us ignore them,and for some they can become a more than disastrous reality.Buenos Aires. March 2017. Félix got up like any other day, at six in the morning. He had toast with raspberry jam for breakfast. For more than a year he had wanted a change in his life, routine, boring, according to him tired of everything, the office, physical activity, his girlfriend.
He thought about some facts and in his thoughts he changed them to others at the moment when the spoon fell to the floor generating an unbearable sound. He felt dizzy, he walked to the bathroom, he noticed that the photo of his mother on the dresser had a hole in it, that was not normal.
He entered the bathroom and everything was in order, but when he came out the reality was different. I didn’t know where I was. It wasn’t his room. He was scared, “they have kidnapped me and drugged me” was the first thing he thought. He looked around. He looked at the photo of his mother where it said “I will never forget you.”
I will give" was his handwriting, however he did not remember writing it. Scared, he called his mother’s house, wrong number?
His apartment looked different, it didn’t seem the same, it was more luxurious, elegant, orderly. Confused he went out into the street. The building where I lived was also different, like the streets, and the entire city. I didn’t know where I was, what year it was, and what I was doing there; He asked for information and they looked at him like a “crazy” person. Finally someone told him that it was the year 2040 and he was in the city of “Aires de Omega”. Increasingly confused, he began to think he might be dreaming. He used every resource to try to wake up and it was useless.
How could the year 2040 be? Did he travel in time? It couldn’t be true. He tried to put his mind together, what had he done to produce this change? Didn’t his mother exist in this world? Or it could be that… He called his girlfriend, and no one answered.
He turned on the shower; perhaps a bath would clear it up. The phone rang, he hesitated to answer it, but he picked up the tube. It was a certain Alfredo who claimed to be his “psychiatrist.” Félix, increasingly confused, asked about his mother, and from the other side he heard an expression of disappointment, followed by:
–The medication is not working, see me tomorrow at my consulting room.
-But why? –Félix asked excitedly. Someone who explain to me Alfredo was silent for a few seconds, then he said: –Félix, your mother died more than ten years ago.
And that’s when Felix’s head clicked and then exploded…literally…Apparently the changes he wanted worked in such a way that they built a new world of nightmares, like a diabolical game. In his mind, like a flash, a falling spoon appeared.
He tried to repeat the sequence again to try to understand these disastrous events that now constituted this present. The sunlight shone again with blinding force. He opened his eyes and his room changed again; This time it was a disaster; a complete disaster, worn out, abused.
The photos corroded by the fungus on the walls seemed a sad reflection of their past. Someone knocked on the door, it was the janitor. He saw its horns and demonic appearance. And finally he understood everything. “It was you,” he told her.
–You are wrong, Félix, you were able to change realities, something that demons cannot do, except me, of course, we use you, to contradict the laws of nature.
I didn’t know what to think. Was he going crazy? What if he ran away? But from what? From whom? It was likely that what was happening was a hallucination, but he had long since given up the joint. He thought of a way to not contradict nature, and tried to erase the demon that was using him as a floor rag to have fun for a while. I thought that would fix everything. However, that reality changed again and this time he found himself in hell itself, why? he asked himself. Eliminating that demon meant returning to normal, but he was wrong.
“You can’t eliminate someone superior to you,” Pharox told him. Demon controller of time and space – That daring can turn your world into true torment.
A terrifying sound diverted his attention. Through the window He saw the flight of a horrendous creature. The sky was covered. Of them, had Felix caused the end of the world?
He cried out of helplessness and despair. He escaped. In the streets he found what he was looking for; a different but unwanted reality; The desire of his anxiety to be something he was not had taken him to that limit. Suddenly the demons followed him everywhere. He wandered the world, alone, surrounded by hideous creatures. Suddenly it appeared Pharox.
– Don’t you think the landscape is beautiful? -asked. Humanity was over, it was their fault, there was no doubt. After walking for a long time he began to get used to that world until that reality too faded. He understood what his true power was; that of changing your karma with thought.
And so Félix realized that desires condemn us to our own destiny.
“Even though you haven’t answered me, I forgive you, because I see that you are in a moment of reflection,” Pharox told him, appearing out of nowhere again.
Felix walked to hell now located on earth, the paradoxes getting worse every time. His house, his room were a thing of the past, now they belonged to another world, which after all he did not dislike so much.
Something peculiar was that he did not feel guilt, the same one that eats away at our heads when we believe that we are guilty of everything around us, and are we?
Pharox, tired of having fun with Félix, proposed a macabre game, imagining the worst reality; the most catastrophic for both.
Even though he had just learned about his powers, Félix accepted the challenge. They would play with their imagination until they found each other’s weakest point. The prize for Félix would be to return to reality; to his world, the one he knew. And Pharox would keep Felix’s soul and his powers to be a complete entity.
– What do you mean by becoming a complete being? –Asked Félix who already tasted victory.
Pharox lit his pipe, which emitted a strange, nauseating-smelling smoke, while he explained to Felix that he was his other half; and that once complete he would rule hell and earth. But enough of words. The game had to start.
They sat at a round table with strange engravings, which looked familiar to Felix. The two would imagine the perfect nightmare for the other. Pharox started. Felix suddenly found himself in a world surrounded only by darkness, and a crimson light that showed him the way forward. He moved forward trusting his instinct.
Nothing scared him.
“I thought the worst fear of human beings was loneliness and darkness,” said Pharox, smoking his pipe. Not for Félix, who managed to banish that nightmare. They returned to the imaginary board, it was Félix’s turn.
He imagined a temple, a church, Pharox laughed out loud. –That doesn’t scare anyone, my dear Félix, in fact, I invite you to smoke the moss of hell with me before you lose.
The world that Pharox projected for Felix was a reality where demons committed the worst atrocities, which were enhanced by the smoke that invaded his brain to the point of making him believe he would go mad. However, he was stronger than his opponent believed and managed to dominate his mind.
When Pharox noticed that the moss in his pipe had run out, he proposed to Felix that he accompany him to the shore of the rivers of hell where they grew. “Maybe that was the reason” for that nauseating smell. Along the way they talked about everything that humanity went through until the end of their days. Little by little and despite being rivals, they became friends. They sat on a cliff and together they smoked more than necessary.
Recess was over. The game had to continue. They returned to the board; the dark angel who watched over him disappeared. Where were we? –Felix said. I think it’s my turn. “If it’s your turn,” Pharox replied.
– Felix imagined the worst for a demon; The same sky. He took Pharox to a place full of angels and shining golden lights. Pharox felt fear, and for the first time he tried to find the exit as quickly as possible; That world of angels and beings of light hammered his mind with songs and praises.
As Felix’s time expired, Pharox foresaw his own destruction, when the piercing cries of hell almost destroyed his ears, was it not an angelic song to him? Pharox felt the cold that human beings feel when they face a being from beyond. His turn came. If the darkness didn’t scare Felix, what was there left for him to do? He couldn’t create any reality. He felt defeated. Felix took pity on him and let his turn pass, did he really take pity? Or for the first time a human was torturing a demon? Could it be that the human is more destructive than Lucifer himself?
“Don’t be too smart,” Pharox warned him. And he invited him to continue. It was his turn again, he would show Félix a world where his loved ones were murdered in the worst way; And so he did until Félix smiled again, so much so that he laughed out loud.
–I think for the first time someone has made you nervous, right? Pharox angry with himself; He got up from the table and asked for two minutes, he had to clear his head or desperation would drive him crazy.
There was no doubt the roles were changed, a human being was causing terror to a demon. Félix approached him, and offered him
He put his pride aside, ended the game and let the world return to normal. Pharox shook the earth with a piercing scream and warned him not to underestimate him.
When he calmed down and could think, he realized that what he had believed until now about Felix was a mistake; It wasn’t his other half, but someone, perhaps a chosen one, or an angel? If Pharox gave up it would be his end not only in the hell he planned to build on earth to betray Lucifer.
He closed his eyes and smoked more infernal moss, trying not to succumb to nervousness, and felt how the toxic cloud penetrated his being.
When he opened them he found himself in Felix’s room; where it all began, Pharox, he knew that this was another trap of that imbecile human, besides, what could the human world do to a higher-ranking demon? Unfortunately for Pharox, the worst was yet to come.
– “Humans can’t scare me” – he said to himself when he left the apartment, but no one noticed his presence, since for society he was like a ghost, they didn’t see him.
He experienced firsthand the misfortune of loneliness, of no one noticing his presence, of no one even speaking to him and, worse still, he could no longer return to the infernal land and continue with the game to win it and get out of that hell that was the human world.
Scared more than usual, he tried to remember how he entered that horrible world, and his memory marked the moment when his pipe began to smoke. Was it a nightmare, or was Felix the culprit?
Another torment of the human world was present, doubt. I don’t Great to find the solution to his problem, he wandered through the world tormented by doubt.
He hated human beings more; even more so since he felt humiliated by one of them. He went to the table; Felix, his worst nightmare, was waiting for him there.
“I will only let you win on one condition,” said Pharox.
Which? – Know who you really are. Félix accepted the condition but still could not reveal the truth. He suggested calming his nerves since the worst for Pharox had not yet come. First he recommended that he tell him the truth, and that he explain why he had created that hell on earth. Pharox explained that his purpose was to use him to betray Lucifer; and banish it.
“That was your worst mistake,” Félix told him, smiling as he undressed. It folded a never-before-seen potential of multicolored lights.
The world was populated with demons. Now Hell had increased its forces thanks to Pharox’s plan failing; another trap from Félix, a being capable of deceiving even the very saints.
–Game Over, you fell into our trap. –Wait, what are you going to do with me? –Pharox said. –We are going to banish you to the paradox where the world continues to function; where you belong. You were causing a lot of trouble for both good and evil, – Wait!… Mercy!
–Goodbye Pharox. It was fun playing with you.
Thus Pharox began to completely disintegrate. Now his worst punishment would be to be reincarnated in the human world. Everything in that real ity was transformed into fortresses of evil, Félix’s dream was fulfilled.
But we still didn’t know his real name. Felix adjusted his wings and headed to the palace of his master Lucifer. As he walked he smoked the moss and the singing of the demons made him laugh.
The palace opened its immense doors, the questions did not cease to cease in the tormented mind of Pharox who now reincarnated as a human being continued to wonder: Who really was Felix? How could he live in the human world and not be affected if he is a demon?
Dressed in a black robe, Lucifer was waiting for him, – Good job Judas, he told him – master demon of lies, deception and betrayal – Felix laughed, he had finally left the past behind… forever…
summary:
The Pharox Paradox © Joel Aguilozi, 2020
Sometimes when we are not satisfied with our lives, with what wedo, we mistakenly wish for changes that did not occur, and weask ourselves, What if I had done this? What would my life belike? If I had finished university? Or would I have mademore money? Paradoxes exist, many of us ignore them,and for some they can become a more than disastrous reality.
title: The Pharox Paradox

What happens when, due to a limiting circumstance that occurs in the course of life, the fears that lay dormant in our minds are shown as a reality, causing our destiny, in a turn as unexpected as it is drastic, to open in two or more parallel channels?
This is the story of Naomi Berks, a guardian of the law who, in the performance of her duty, is hit by a bullet that puts her in a deep coma.
Five Thousand Days and One Night

In a laboratory, a young man who lies asleep wakes up from his lethargy to begin the adventure that will lead him to change his world and everyone’s. John Roswell, that’s his name, is an android, created for that purpose.
In his brain there is a chip carrying the most ambitious project ever thought of until now, the so-called “Kabbalah Project.” For this, John and a group of friends who are harvesting along the way, must search in different and strategic predetermined places, the ten emeralds of the tree of life, the Sephirot.
Project Kabbalah

I’m Joel Aguilozi, a Science Fiction writer eager to expand my horizons and venture into the world of production and artistic direction. As a passionate art enthusiast, I have worked as a chronicler and photographer at music concerts, and I am very dedicated to video games as a fan, gamer, tester, and analyst.
I have always enjoyed creating things, and to my writing production, I add experiences in programming and 3D design. Since completing my studies, I have worked in various IT sectors, including moderation and analysis, testing multiplatform games, and venturing into production.
Since finishing my studies, I have worked in various IT sectors, such as moderation and analysis, testing cross-platform games, and venturing into production.
My strengths are creating storylines, designing timelines, and providing user feedback. The last few years in the gaming sector have been where I have grown the most personally and professionally, facing all kinds of challenges and meeting exceptional people.
I consider myself a lifelong learner, always thirsty for knowledge and eager to explore new technologies.
Creating an immersive and disruptive experience with deep emotional content is not only one of my goals but also part of my growth and evolution.
I do sports to disconnect and recharge, as well as spend time with my family. At night, I usually continue studying to delve deeper into this wonderful world of technology. There is always something new to learn, whether it’s reading books, watching videos, taking courses, or writing notes. Besides that, the best way to learn is by doing, not just watching others do it. Therefore, I dedicate time to creating projects or proof of concept on topics I want to delve into and master to later apply them in my work or future projects. You can see some of my projects at Projects.
